Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. As the UAE continues to position itself as a hub for innovation and international business, this small but powerful change plays a key role in enhancing visibility and trust in its currency.hashtag#UAE hashtag#Dirham hashtag#AED hashtag#CurrencySymbol hashtag#Finance hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Economy hashtag#Innovation hashtag#GCC hashtag#GlobalFinance

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Thinking about a rent increase in Dubai? Here's what you need to know:According to Decree No. (43) of 2013, any rent hike must align with RERAâ€™s smart rental index. Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. If your lease is up for renewal in 2025, the latest rental index will be appliedâ€”otherwise, the previous index stays in effect.Connect ğŸ“§ - kamran@equitixcapital.comkamranalam.realtor@gmail.comğŸ“ â¡ï¸ +971523055356hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#RentalLaws hashtag#RERA hashtag#TenantRights hashtag#DubaiRentals hashtag#RealEstateUAE hashtag#RentalGuide hashtag#DubaiLiving hashtag#RentalTips hashtag#PropertyLaw hashtag#LandlordTenantLaw hashtag#DubaiProperty hashtag#Dubai hashtag#EquitixCapitalRealEstate hashtag#Tenant hashtag#Law

UAE Introduces Official Currency Symbol for the Dirham (AED).The United Arab Emirates has officially introduced a new symbol for its currency, the UAE Dirham (AED), marking a significant milestone in the countryâ€™s financial journey. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. As the UAE continues to position itself as a hub for innovation and international business, this small but powerful change plays a key role in enhancing visibility and trust in its currency.hashtag#UAE hashtag#Dirham hashtag#AED hashtag#CurrencySymbol hashtag#Finance hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Economy hashtag#Innovation hashtag#GCC hashtag#GlobalFinance

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

The agreement was signed by our Director General Hala Badri, and Professor Michael Allen, Acting Vice President of Zayed University, following the launch of the 'Common Grounds' exhibition curated by students from the university, featuring selected works from the Dubai Collection. Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

UAE Introduces Official Currency Symbol for the Dirham (AED).The United Arab Emirates has officially introduced a new symbol for its currency, the UAE Dirham (AED), marking a significant milestone in the countryâ€™s financial journey. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. As the UAE continues to position itself as a hub for innovation and international business, this small but powerful change plays a key role in enhancing visibility and trust in its currency.hashtag#UAE hashtag#Dirham hashtag#AED hashtag#CurrencySymbol hashtag#Finance hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Economy hashtag#Innovation hashtag#GCC hashtag#GlobalFinance

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. UAE Introduces Official Currency Symbol for the Dirham (AED).The United Arab Emirates has officially introduced a new symbol for its currency, the UAE Dirham (AED), marking a significant milestone in the countryâ€™s financial journey. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. As the UAE continues to position itself as a hub for innovation and international business, this small but powerful change plays a key role in enhancing visibility and trust in its currency.hashtag#UAE hashtag#Dirham hashtag#AED hashtag#CurrencySymbol hashtag#Finance hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Economy hashtag#Innovation hashtag#GCC hashtag#GlobalFinance

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. "Salaries Based on Passport" â€” Still a Reality in Dubai? ğŸš¨After months of recruiting across Dubai, one truth keeps showing up again and again:ğŸ“Œ Candidates from Western countries (UK, US, EU) often demand 2xâ€“3x higher salaries than equally experienced professionals from Asia or Africa. ğŸ“Œ And employers pay it. ğŸ“Œ Meanwhile, highly skilled professionals from the Global South are expected to â€œsettleâ€ for less, even when delivering the same (or better) results.Weâ€™ve seen job ads offering 25K+ AED exclusively for candidates from the West, while local candidates â€” even with proven capabilities â€” get offered half that.Whatâ€™s the logic? ğŸ§  Is it still about passport privilege? ğŸŒ Is it outdated perceptions of value? ğŸ’¼ Or is it baked-in bias masked as â€œinternational standardsâ€?Everyone in Dubai pays the same rent, the same fuel, the same VAT. Why isnâ€™t pay based on skills and impact instead of origin?This isnâ€™t just about salaries â€” it's about respect, opportunity, and a fair playing field.ğŸ’¬ Would love to hear from recruiters, professionals, and HR leaders: Have you experienced this? Why does it still persist? And how do we change it?Letâ€™s spark a real conversation about pay equity in Dubai.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. As the UAE continues to position itself as a hub for innovation and international business, this small but powerful change plays a key role in enhancing visibility and trust in its currency.hashtag#UAE hashtag#Dirham hashtag#AED hashtag#CurrencySymbol hashtag#Finance hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Economy hashtag#Innovation hashtag#GCC hashtag#GlobalFinance

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. "Salaries Based on Passport" â€” Still a Reality in Dubai? ğŸš¨After months of recruiting across Dubai, one truth keeps showing up again and again:ğŸ“Œ Candidates from Western countries (UK, US, EU) often demand 2xâ€“3x higher salaries than equally experienced professionals from Asia or Africa. ğŸ“Œ And employers pay it. ğŸ“Œ Meanwhile, highly skilled professionals from the Global South are expected to â€œsettleâ€ for less, even when delivering the same (or better) results.Weâ€™ve seen job ads offering 25K+ AED exclusively for candidates from the West, while local candidates â€” even with proven capabilities â€” get offered half that.Whatâ€™s the logic? ğŸ§  Is it still about passport privilege? ğŸŒ Is it outdated perceptions of value? ğŸ’¼ Or is it baked-in bias masked as â€œinternational standardsâ€?Everyone in Dubai pays the same rent, the same fuel, the same VAT. Why isnâ€™t pay based on skills and impact instead of origin?This isnâ€™t just about salaries â€” it's about respect, opportunity, and a fair playing field.ğŸ’¬ Would love to hear from recruiters, professionals, and HR leaders: Have you experienced this? Why does it still persist? And how do we change it?Letâ€™s spark a real conversation about pay equity in Dubai.

Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. "Salaries Based on Passport" â€” Still a Reality in Dubai? ğŸš¨After months of recruiting across Dubai, one truth keeps showing up again and again:ğŸ“Œ Candidates from Western countries (UK, US, EU) often demand 2xâ€“3x higher salaries than equally experienced professionals from Asia or Africa. ğŸ“Œ And employers pay it. ğŸ“Œ Meanwhile, highly skilled professionals from the Global South are expected to â€œsettleâ€ for less, even when delivering the same (or better) results.Weâ€™ve seen job ads offering 25K+ AED exclusively for candidates from the West, while local candidates â€” even with proven capabilities â€” get offered half that.Whatâ€™s the logic? ğŸ§  Is it still about passport privilege? ğŸŒ Is it outdated perceptions of value? ğŸ’¼ Or is it baked-in bias masked as â€œinternational standardsâ€?Everyone in Dubai pays the same rent, the same fuel, the same VAT. Why isnâ€™t pay based on skills and impact instead of origin?This isnâ€™t just about salaries â€” it's about respect, opportunity, and a fair playing field.ğŸ’¬ Would love to hear from recruiters, professionals, and HR leaders: Have you experienced this? Why does it still persist? And how do we change it?Letâ€™s spark a real conversation about pay equity in Dubai.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. "Salaries Based on Passport" â€” Still a Reality in Dubai? ğŸš¨After months of recruiting across Dubai, one truth keeps showing up again and again:ğŸ“Œ Candidates from Western countries (UK, US, EU) often demand 2xâ€“3x higher salaries than equally experienced professionals from Asia or Africa. ğŸ“Œ And employers pay it. ğŸ“Œ Meanwhile, highly skilled professionals from the Global South are expected to â€œsettleâ€ for less, even when delivering the same (or better) results.Weâ€™ve seen job ads offering 25K+ AED exclusively for candidates from the West, while local candidates â€” even with proven capabilities â€” get offered half that.Whatâ€™s the logic? ğŸ§  Is it still about passport privilege? ğŸŒ Is it outdated perceptions of value? ğŸ’¼ Or is it baked-in bias masked as â€œinternational standardsâ€?Everyone in Dubai pays the same rent, the same fuel, the same VAT. Why isnâ€™t pay based on skills and impact instead of origin?This isnâ€™t just about salaries â€” it's about respect, opportunity, and a fair playing field.ğŸ’¬ Would love to hear from recruiters, professionals, and HR leaders: Have you experienced this? Why does it still persist? And how do we change it?Letâ€™s spark a real conversation about pay equity in Dubai.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. "Salaries Based on Passport" â€” Still a Reality in Dubai? ğŸš¨After months of recruiting across Dubai, one truth keeps showing up again and again:ğŸ“Œ Candidates from Western countries (UK, US, EU) often demand 2xâ€“3x higher salaries than equally experienced professionals from Asia or Africa. ğŸ“Œ And employers pay it. ğŸ“Œ Meanwhile, highly skilled professionals from the Global South are expected to â€œsettleâ€ for less, even when delivering the same (or better) results.Weâ€™ve seen job ads offering 25K+ AED exclusively for candidates from the West, while local candidates â€” even with proven capabilities â€” get offered half that.Whatâ€™s the logic? ğŸ§  Is it still about passport privilege? ğŸŒ Is it outdated perceptions of value? ğŸ’¼ Or is it baked-in bias masked as â€œinternational standardsâ€?Everyone in Dubai pays the same rent, the same fuel, the same VAT. Why isnâ€™t pay based on skills and impact instead of origin?This isnâ€™t just about salaries â€” it's about respect, opportunity, and a fair playing field.ğŸ’¬ Would love to hear from recruiters, professionals, and HR leaders: Have you experienced this? Why does it still persist? And how do we change it?Letâ€™s spark a real conversation about pay equity in Dubai.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. This move is more than symbolic â€” it helps standardize the way prices and financial figures are represented, especially in digital systems, international trade, and financial reports.The adoption of a currency symbol also reflects the UAEâ€™s broader vision of economic modernization. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. As the UAE continues to position itself as a hub for innovation and international business, this small but powerful change plays a key role in enhancing visibility and trust in its currency.hashtag#UAE hashtag#Dirham hashtag#AED hashtag#CurrencySymbol hashtag#Finance hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#Economy hashtag#Innovation hashtag#GCC hashtag#GlobalFinance

How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. "Salaries Based on Passport" â€” Still a Reality in Dubai? ğŸš¨After months of recruiting across Dubai, one truth keeps showing up again and again:ğŸ“Œ Candidates from Western countries (UK, US, EU) often demand 2xâ€“3x higher salaries than equally experienced professionals from Asia or Africa. ğŸ“Œ And employers pay it. ğŸ“Œ Meanwhile, highly skilled professionals from the Global South are expected to â€œsettleâ€ for less, even when delivering the same (or better) results.Weâ€™ve seen job ads offering 25K+ AED exclusively for candidates from the West, while local candidates â€” even with proven capabilities â€” get offered half that.Whatâ€™s the logic? ğŸ§  Is it still about passport privilege? ğŸŒ Is it outdated perceptions of value? ğŸ’¼ Or is it baked-in bias masked as â€œinternational standardsâ€?Everyone in Dubai pays the same rent, the same fuel, the same VAT. Why isnâ€™t pay based on skills and impact instead of origin?This isnâ€™t just about salaries â€” it's about respect, opportunity, and a fair playing field.ğŸ’¬ Would love to hear from recruiters, professionals, and HR leaders: Have you experienced this? Why does it still persist? And how do we change it?Letâ€™s spark a real conversation about pay equity in Dubai.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.

Why UK Investors Are Relocating to Dubai in 2025From billionaire business leaders like Lakshmi Mittal to everyday landlords â€” UK investors are moving their capital, families, and futures to Dubai. Hereâ€™s why:Whatâ€™s Pushing Them Away from the UK:1ï¸âƒ£ End of Non-Dom Tax StatusFrom April 2025, non-doms living in the UK for over 4 years will be taxed on their worldwide income and gains â€” ending a key tax advantage for global investors.2ï¸âƒ£ Rising Capital Gains & Stamp DutiesCapital Gains Tax has increased to 24% for high earners, and stamp duty on second homes now adds an extra 5%. UK real estate returns are shrinking.3ï¸âƒ£ Public Wealth DisclosureProperty held via offshore entities must now be publicly declared. High-net-worth individuals are losing financial privacy.4ï¸âƒ£ Crime & Safety ConcernsBurglaries, knife crime, and financial fraud are on the rise â€” especially in major cities. Many wealthy families feel increasingly unsafe.5ï¸âƒ£ Political & Regulatory FatigueThe climate is shifting against wealth, landlords, and developers. Investors fear aggressive future policies, especially with political changes looming.6ï¸âƒ£ 40% Inheritance TaxEstates over Â£325,000 are taxed heavily, making it harder to pass on wealth to future generations.Why Dubai Is Pulling Them In:1ï¸âƒ£ 0% Income, Capital Gains & Inheritance TaxDubai offers full tax-free returns â€” helping investors protect and grow their wealth.2ï¸âƒ£ Financial Privacy & Flexible StructuresSecure asset holding through trusts, foundations, and offshore entities â€” all with confidentiality.3ï¸âƒ£ World-Class Safety & StabilityDubai is one of the safest cities in the world, with near-zero street crime and a highly secure environment for families and assets.4ï¸âƒ£ Next-Gen Infrastructure & Investment ZonesAI-powered smart cities, futuristic transport, and endless real estate innovation. Dubai is building for tomorrow.5ï¸âƒ£ Smooth Legacy & Wealth PlanningTrust-friendly frameworks and zero inheritance tax make it easy to plan generational wealth transfers.The Outcome:UK nationals became the #1 foreign real estate buyer group in Dubai in 2024, accounting for 12% of total transactions.This isnâ€™t just relocation. Itâ€™s a strategic shift in global wealth.

AbuDhabi Autonomous Racing League (A2RL), known for pushing the boundaries of AI innovation and next-gen mobility, just made history in a way the world wonâ€™t forget. In partnership with the Drone Champions League (DCL), A2RL hosted the most sophisticated and demanding drone race ever seenâ€”and an AI-powered drone beat a world-class human pilot. AI Wins Autonomous Drone Race in Abu Dhabi wasnâ€™t just a headline; it was a defining moment for autonomous tech and aerial robotics.Key Highlights:â€¢ MavLabâ€™s AI drone (TU Delft) won the AI vs Human Challenge, completing 2 laps in just 17 secondsâ€¢ TII Racing dominated the Multi-Drone Race, proving AIâ€™s ability in high-speed coordination and collision avoidanceâ€¢ MavLab also won the worldâ€™s first AI-only drag race, showing unmatched speed and controlâ€¢ All drones relied solely on real-time AI, flying over 150 km/h through a low-visibility, high-difficulty courseâ€¢ 100+ Emirati students trained in the A2RL x DCL STEM program, with 60% earning certifications and 24 scoring perfectlyH.E. "Salaries Based on Passport" â€” Still a Reality in Dubai? ğŸš¨After months of recruiting across Dubai, one truth keeps showing up again and again:ğŸ“Œ Candidates from Western countries (UK, US, EU) often demand 2xâ€“3x higher salaries than equally experienced professionals from Asia or Africa. ğŸ“Œ And employers pay it. ğŸ“Œ Meanwhile, highly skilled professionals from the Global South are expected to â€œsettleâ€ for less, even when delivering the same (or better) results.Weâ€™ve seen job ads offering 25K+ AED exclusively for candidates from the West, while local candidates â€” even with proven capabilities â€” get offered half that.Whatâ€™s the logic? ğŸ§  Is it still about passport privilege? ğŸŒ Is it outdated perceptions of value? ğŸ’¼ Or is it baked-in bias masked as â€œinternational standardsâ€?Everyone in Dubai pays the same rent, the same fuel, the same VAT. Why isnâ€™t pay based on skills and impact instead of origin?This isnâ€™t just about salaries â€” it's about respect, opportunity, and a fair playing field.ğŸ’¬ Would love to hear from recruiters, professionals, and HR leaders: Have you experienced this? Why does it still persist? And how do we change it?Letâ€™s spark a real conversation about pay equity in Dubai.

Landlords are only permitted to raise the rent if the index justifies itâ€”and they must give tenants a 90-day notice in advance.Disagree with the increase? You have the right to escalate the matter to the Rental Dispute Centre.Under Articles 13 & 14 of Law No. 33 of 2008, both landlords and tenants can negotiate rent terms before contract renewal. Just like the US Dollar ($), Euro (â‚¬), and British Pound (Â£), the Dirham now has a unique identity that enhances its global recognition. It strengthens the national financial identity, supports the countryâ€™s growing digital economy, and makes the Dirham more accessible and recognizable on the global stage. How does your international development resume demonstrate your experience designing and managing donor-funded development programs across diverse regions? Tip: Mention sectors (health, education, governance, etc.), donor types (USAID, World Bank, EU), and geographic scope.To answer this well on your resume, show that you have:Led or contributed to donor-funded development programs in specific sectors such as health, education, climate, livelihoods, or governance.Worked with multiple donorsâ€”like USAID, DFID/FCDO, World Bank, EU, or UN agenciesâ€”and understand their compliance, reporting, and proposal development requirements.Worked across diverse regions or countriesâ€”mention locations to show geographic adaptability and contextual knowledge.Used development tools or approaches like Theory of Change, Results-Based Management, or Logical Frameworks.Achieved tangible outcomes, such as improved service delivery, increased beneficiary reach, or successful grant acquisition.Sample Resume Bullet Point:Designed and managed multi-donor development programs in health and governance across East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia), including a $4.5M USAID-funded initiative that improved maternal health services and policy coordination at the district level; ensured compliance with donor standards and RBM frameworks.
